definition: to howl in grief/anguished wailing/same as 哀号
sorrow/grief/pity/to grieve for/to pity/to lament/to condole
Ai (c. 2000 BC), sixth of legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Li 釐|厘[Li2]

sentences.english: Have you ever heard the wolf cried to the blue corn moon;
sentences.chinese: 你可曾听过那野狼向着冷月哀嚎？

sentences.english: Sharp ground cry a voice, even appear to cry piteously of cry a voice.
sentences.chinese: 尖锐的哭声，甚至出现哀嚎的哭声。

sentences.english: Or have the eagle tell you where he's been?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾听到过野狼向着冷月的哀嚎？

sentences.english: He let out a sharp cry, followed by waves of wailing.
sentences.chinese: 他发出刺耳的嚎哭声，然后是一浪接一浪的哀嚎。

sentences.english: The pain grew in intensity. He gave a loud moan and vomited all over the floor.
sentences.chinese: 肚子越来越疼，他发出一声痛苦的哀嚎，吐了一地。

sentences.english: We think he went off north to the Wailing Ziggurat.
sentences.chinese: 我们认为他向北去哀嚎通灵塔了。

sentences.english: People often report hearing screams and cries.
sentences.chinese: 人们常听到哀嚎和哭喊。

sentences.english: The animal cried piteously for hours as the farmer tried to figure out what to do.
sentences.chinese: 在农夫想办法救它时，驴子在井里哀嚎了几个小时。

sentences.english: The pig wailed off the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 这时候猪的哀嚎声，震于天际。

sentences.english: Have you ever heard the wolf cry to the blue corn moon?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾听到过野狼向着冷月的哀嚎？

definition: to cry piteously/anguished wailing/same as 哀嚎

to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
to wail like ghosts and howl like wolves (idiom)
to roar/to thunder/to snarl/to bluster (of wind, waves etc)/crashing waves (onom.)/to rage (of a person)
